page.title: 19Police Officer Interview
page.content: Peter Dobson is the Chief Police Officer for the Pocklington area. {Q. How does the crime rate compare {with other places in the country?} A. Taking into account the density of the population and the type of location it is, it is similar pro rata to the rest of the country. {Q. What are the main crimes in the {area and which age groups are {responsible for them?} A. The main crimes are burglary, minor theft, and damage. Burglaries are committed mainly by travelling criminals, from the York, west Riding, and South Yorkshire areas. Minor theft and criminal damage (vandalism), is usually done by local youngsters between the ages of 12 and 20, but particularly those between the ages of 15 and 18 years.
